review: With the lime green ball joints there seems to be a bad batch has come to this set. Also at mine the lime green pieces are destroyed after the first use. I contacted TLC and got new ones. Now all probs are solved.

author: Vorahk1Panrahk2
title: One of the More Decent Mahri
review:
The canister image portrays Hahli very well, and in a way that is bound to attract consumers. It's a decent enough canister, portraying Hahli on the front, and an image of Mahri Nui on the back, along with other pictures that demonstrate functions, show storyline, etc. It's a bit hard to open, but you get over it eventually. 

One part of the set that capture my attention was the build. It seemed strange not starting with the torso right away, and attaching he mask sooner than usual. Otherwise it's a simple build. The only real issue is with the tube. It's somewhat difficult to find a good way to attach them to the mask so it looks natural, and so the pipes won't detach from resistance. I would have preferred a different way of attachment, one that's easier to deal with. 

Hahli's color scheme is loved by some, and disliked by others. I am rather fond of it. The combination of dark blue and lime green is much different than what we're used to (combinations of blue and light blue/silver), and different is always good. I also find it as a representation of her mask power, which in the story adapts powers from creatures around her. The lime green gives the sense of bioluminescence, which is something used by creatures underwater.

Another thing that makes Hahli original are her (new!) wings. The first thing that came to my head about them was: why? After all, the characters are water based. I then concluded that this was another way to signify the character's mask power. Besides, either way, they really do look nice, and can even fold behind her back for storage. Her other tool, a claw, I am not as fond of. It doesn't look horrible, but it's not an amazing tool either. 'Claw' isn't necessarily the first thing that comes to mind when I look at it. But it is a major improvement over her previous Inika tool, so she needs credit there. 

Playing with Hahli is fun. The Cordak blaster is especially fun. It shoots really well, and pretty far. The ammo doesn't fall out, either (like the previous Zamors and Rhotuka). The only downside is that the blasters are a tad heavy, but this isn't too horrible if the joints on the set are good. 

To conclude, Hahli is one of my favorite, probably my second favorite, Toa Mahri. Good design, nice (new!) wing pieces, and a good source of fun earns this set a 5/5

author: Anakin_Brickwalker
title: Scary, but cool
review:
To me, this is the scariest bionicle set that I own. Ever since the first incident, I've been afraid of breaking the lime green sockets. Otherwise, this is my  favourite 2007 set.

Pros
-choice of colours
-wings
-claw
-mask

cons
- lime green joint sockets frighten me

author: Gus_263
title: Cool, but not so good quality
review: The Toa Mahri innovate some pieces, but some of they have problems, like Hahli's problems. Hahli have a awesome design, but i don't like much the weapons. I think that the Hahli's talon is not that thing for a water toa, and the cordak blaster don't blast easily. Another problem, and the most terrible, are the lime green pieces. Like Ehlek and Lesovikk, these pieces broken so easy, and that is a obstacle to do creations with Hahli. I hope that the 2008 Lewa nuva lime green pieces will not broken easy. But Hahli have some good things, like the wings (they are not so good for a underwater toa, but are good designed), and the mask, really what i was searching for a water toa. Hahli is a good set, only be cautious with the lime green pieces if you buy it.

author: BionicleBOOM
title: Toa Mahri Hahli ROX!!
review:
My favorite set of all time (don't rib me because it's a girl), Hahli is definitely a ten out of five.  I don't know what's so special about her; maybe it's the wings, talon, Cordak launcher, and the all-together water feel about her that appeals to my eye.  So, what's the Pros and Cons?

Pros:

Wings (that's definitely #1)

Cordak Rocket Launcher

Talon

Mask is AWESOME!!

Very very VERY posable

Cons:

Lime green pieces do, in fact, break very easily.  Luckily, it was easy to get replacements.  But now that Hahli's discontinued, I dunno what I'd do if they did now.

Other than the breakable green pieces, Hahli is one of the best sets Lego has EVER MADE.  Get Hahli now, but just be careful about the lime green pieces!

title: Yes, general Hahli
review:
Good title, huh? I just like calling her like that. Hahli is a great toa and her wings make her look more awesome. I like the shape of it, too. Now to the pros and cons:

Pros:
-super-awesome wings
-nice blaster that really fires(the harder you push it, the torpedoes go further)
-good mask with breathing gear
-nice claws
-i like the shape of the body parts
-nice head

Cons:
-lime green pieces break too easily(mine is all broken)
-nothing else!

I give it 4.5/5.0 because of those lime parts.
Hope it is not like that on other bionicles.

author: Stronius8888
title: The Toa Mahri of Water!
review:
Toa Hahli is my favourite Toa Mahri (2007). She has a typical Inika build, and the Cordak Blaster of 2007. Now I will reveal her (the set's) pros and cons.

PROS:
-Talons are pretty cool.
-Cordak Blaster looks cool and is actually pretty easy to use.
-Wings are a awesome design.
-Kanohi Faxon (the mask) is a very nice design.

CONS
-Lime pieces are very crisp and break easily.
-The breathing tubes slightly impair head movement.

Overall, Toa Hali is a fantastic set and I reccomend it to any Bionicle fan.

Cons

Overall, i'd say this set gets a 8 out of 10 rating. the play experience is fun, but, like any other lego set, you get bored of it after about a week... And next thing you know, you're saving up for another toa mahri!

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO BIONICLE (Toa Mahri) - Toa Hahli Review
review:
This is a cool figure to have and it's fun to play with as well.

Parts

This set has 59 pieces and it was 10 USD when it was on sale. That means that the price per piece ratio was 15 cents per piece which is a really good value for what this figure.

The build

The build is very nice and easy and we also don't need to complain about stickers.

The completed model

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/8914-1.jpg[/img]


The arms, the hands, the legs, the feet and the head can be adjusted. On one hand we can see a cool looking weapon and on the other hand we get a turret. On the back of this figure we can also see two wings which you can sviwel. The only two things which I don't like about this set is that the turret doesn't really work and that the box can be messed up very easily if you want to open it.

Summary

All in all this set is an great set and I would HIGHLY recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full gallery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de


Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion

Review

author: Nmfrey23
title: My favorite Toa of water
review:
Hahli was an interesting set in 2006, and her Mahri set in 2007 kept up with that trend. A brand-new colour scheme, deadly looking claws and actual wings are just a few of the changes that Hahli saw in 2007. I would almost wholly reccomend this set but there is one major issue that this set, as well as a select few sets from 2007 have that makes this set infinitely worse.

Pros:

New parts: The mask, claw, blaster, breathing tubes and visor are all new parts. There are also many old parts in new colours, like many of the lime green parts.

The set has a unique build to allow the wings to attach (not just standard Toa Inika format).

Wings can move and have a large range of motion.

Cordak blaster works well (holds six shots).

I personally love the colour scheme of navy blue and lime green

Cons:

Weapons are somewhat awkward looking when held.

Due to the tubes and larger mask, head movement is somewhat limited.

I cannot stress this enough. The lime joints. They are even more brittle than joints from 2008-2010. I am not sure what was wrong with the lime pieces in 2007, but if you are receiving this set new or disassembled, take care when building it, since the joints don't just crack, but they will often break into two pieces when attached with too much force.

If you manage to build Hahli without breaking a sweat (or a lime joint), you will likely enjoy the end result. Hahli fits the underwater theme of '07 very well, and has cool features and weapons to boot. 4/5
